This game really needs macros, a few programmable slots where you can assign actions to each character and then just select the macro instead of having to individually instruct each character what to do every single round. Like if you want to do anything but just having everyone do a melee attack. For example maybe you want your wizard to cast fire 1 or 2 instead of doing a pointless attack with their weapon. I've seen this in other games and it works quite well.

Great refreshing game for fans of old school RPGs. Right up there with Final Fantasy!!!
Old school rpg I have been looking for. Fun and nostalgic.

I really wish the D-pad and the "OK" button were both moved about half an inch toward the center of the screen. And I am really unimpressed with the design of the chests. It's a basic looking box colored purple and it's just ugly, sorry. Other than those 2 things I am really enjoying this game. Definitely worth 2 bucks to get a great non-Kemco RPG.

Pretty standard RPG so far and fun. Auto battle features are always appreciated when grinding is needed. The only slight downside I can see so far, is the save, buy and inventory systems. There is a lot of button pushing that needs to be done to save and return to game, buy and equip things and to use items, this could all be streamlined. Weapons, armor and accessories should be able to be bought, sold, equipped and weighed against current equipment, all on the same screen. Otherwise, it's great

The game is captivating and easy to figure out. Smooth controls. Decent story so far. Not to much monologue. The colors are bright. The graphics are cute and distinctive. It reminds of the old ff games. Great exploration so far. You can grind endlessly for everything. Great work so far!

As of all games of this style theres is always room to grow but compared to others on phone this is the first in awhile that first boss killed me for tryning to rush it witch was a very pleasant surprise cant wait to enjoy rest of the game using different team for harder difficulty feels very nostalgic like the first final fantasy
Really great game so far. Good team selection. First time I have played a JRPG with customizable team members to pick game difficulty
Not far into the game but I am really enjoying it. Good old skool battle system and good choice of classes
Great love letter to an era of JRPG's found on video store rental shelves.

Jrpg's are my favorite genre and this may be the best one on mobile I've found! Certainly the best new IP. Controls are smooth, well written, the achievements are a neat addition, and the battles are great with cool animations. If the classics aren't doing it for you, then you cannot go wrong with this game. I'll be playing a lot of it going forward.
Good old school rpg

amazing game

content: Ok so far

Very decent JRPG. Much like the original Dragon Warrior or FFI. The leveling is about right, and feels rewarding each time as you get significant stat increases. A floating joystick would be nice, but the d-pad works just fine. I would have liked some cooler effects on the abilities. I'd have liked to have some secret ultimate weapons and equipment I could get before the main game's end boss. I didn't find the game grindy at all. Just grind until you can afford the newest equipment. Thanks.
replyContent: Thank you so much for your review! So glad to hear you enjoy it. I really appreciate the feedback, I'll be sure to keep those suggestions in mind.

content: A solid JRPG. Controls are workable but clumsy.

Wow! Old school RPG that is really well done. I don't love the controls (wish it was touch for everything) but what is there works really well. I like the different characters, they will make for interesting reply. Story so far is interesting. I like the monster listing with drop entries. Fun game for all old schoolers and newbies alike. Keep up the good work and thanks.
replyContent: Thank you so much!

content: really good

Very interesting concepts. Even though the player builds 4 custom characters, much like the original Final Fantasy, the characters have their own lines! That makes move like a more story centric game, the tries to keep the player moving with a leveling system that discourages grinding in one place.

I like the classic feel. Though I've grown accustomed to modern graphics, I felt ready for a good, classic, story based RPG. I appreciate that this game HAS a story and didn't block the path with every conceivable pay wall trope. I can grind levels if it gets tough, or enjoy the challenge. I can create my own team, and not need to replace a character mid game with a higher star count to win. Quests are meaningful and not a 'daily log-in' grind. This should be the norm, not the exception.
Great fun at a low price. The choice of classes gives a lot of variety in gameplay.
Loving my experience thus far. Lots of ways to customize your party makes it replayable to see what each class can really do.
Really enjoying so far, has a real charm about it!
takes me back to classic RPGs like suikoden 1 and 2 great game

I've enjoyed the best rpg's for well over 20 years now. Eternal Concord does not disappoint. Very well done. I'll be watching for future releases. I believe you could easily design more fleshed out console rpg's with great success!👍👍
replyContent: Such high praise, thank you so much for your review! I'm so glad you enjoyed it and I look forward to making more. People like you are the reason I make games!

content: Last update made a great game even better! Added bluetooth controller capability. Mapping is super easy and works great! Thank you so much for adding! 5+ stars!!!
no replay value. no in app purchases but it shows. if you hold your breath you will die
replyContent: Hello, sorry to hear you are having issues dying. If you would like any help at all please use the Support button in game and I'd be happy to help you with battle tactics. Based on testers and consumer feedback the average game length is 10-15 hours for the main story, and 5-10 for bonus content, for a total of 15-25 hours overall. Thanks!

content: I just beat the second boss after completing the second dungeon, it is an excellent game and I highly recommend it if you enjoy the old-school JRPGs. The story is well thought out and developed, and it has that old school simplicity that so many modern games are missing. If you enjoyed Dragon Warrior/Dragonquest, Final Fantasy I, and Golden Sun then you will love this game. The level grinding to get levels isn't too bad, but I enjoy that since to me it's relaxing. Just be patient.
replyContent: Thank you so much for the review! So glad to hear you are enjoying it so far.

content: good game so far, the weakest point is the story doesn't really do anything new. it looks great and the music is good. The battle system is standard turn based and exactly what you want from this kind of game. The game seems well balanced with difficulty.

content: This is really a great game, it brings me back to when i was a kid and I just love the old game feel. the game is challenging and really fun, I have one request, is there anyway we can do both genders for all the classes? I also like the little things about this game, like snow falling and the sand blowing in area, just really cool! So I beat the game today and I loved it, the Demon King was no joke, this is one of my favorite games! thank you for such a great game!
replyContent: Thank you so much! So glad you like all the details I have in the game. Unfortunately due to budget I wasn't able to add male and female faces and animations for all classes. I already have plans to do that in my next RPG though.

content: This game is a waste of money. It's a lousy rpg that grants you less experience as you level up. Do not purchase it.
replyContent: Hi Kevin, actually I designed my game to give you more experience when you are at lower levels for your benefit; that is why it goes down as you level up. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions, thanks!

content: I really enjoyed playing this game, gave me a real nostalgic feeling of Snes games. The battle system is very interesting, the classes seem well balanced, and monsters were fun to fight. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I feel the game was rather short and lacked involvement in the story part. The game offers some beautiful cave maps and towns, but we don't get any incentive to spend much time there. I think Lufia could inspire them for Eternal Concord 2.
gr3at fun so far, like the controls great for passing time on long journeys. easy to pick up.

I gotta say, i'm impressed with what i've played so far. Usually when it comes to RPGs for moblie, they are ok or at least adverge at best. But here, i can tell there is love and passion put into it. The only thing is the controls are a bit wanky, but everything else is great. THIS, is what mobile games should be. Buy. It.
